page.title: 08WITHIEL FLOREY CHURCH
page.content:
A month after the restoration the building was almost destroyed by fire but a passing labourer noticed some smoke coming from a window and the flames from a stove that had been left to dry out the church were put out.
The last incumbent was in 1872 when the parish was united with Treborough. In this century it was united first with Brompton Regis and in 1971 with Upton Skilgate as well. In 1958 the building was said to be dangerous and{a closed notice was put up but {after an appeal and a big effort to {raise the money the church was {reopened after a fine piece of {restoration in 1961. {The registers began in 1697. { }
